B2 to charge someone an amount of money as a punishment for not obeying a rule or law: Drivers who exceed the speed limit can expect to be fined heavily. [ + two objects ] They fined him £100 for using threatening behaviour. Synonym
ticket
More examplesFewer examplesHe was fined for defacing library books.She was fined for speeding last month.The council has begun to fine drivers who park in the bus lanes.The judge decided to fine him rather than impose a prison sentence.He was fined for impersonating a police officer.
